intro: Weberbauera peruviana, commonly known as the Peruvian Weberbauera, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pentagonal flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
